result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Francisco J Herrera

records.addlTxt: Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Francisco J Herrera in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael a Verrilli in court for Francisco J Herrera.  Attorney Grant Ian Huebner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State has complied with victim notification.  Defense is having issues with the electronic media device.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for March 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Francisco J Herrera in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael a Verrilli in court with Francisco J Herrera.  Attorney Grant Ian Huebner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defense has recieved discovery, but is having issues viewing the surveillance video.  Defense request another scheduling date.  State has not given an offer as of yet.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Michael a Verrilli in court, defendant Francisco J Herrera not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Discovery received.  Needs to review with client.  Defense request another adjourned date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Francisco J Herrera in court with Attorney Michael A Verrilli; both appear by video.  Defendant Francisco J Herrera in custody.  Paul Tiffin appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Nemuth. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.   
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 06, Judge Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael a Verrilli in court, defendant Francisco J Herrera not in court, in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Order to show cause.  The matter was HELD OFF THE RECORD via email.  Attorney Verrilli will be the counsel of record.  The parties agreed to the Preliminary hearing date via email.  The court order the matter adjourned to Branch 15.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Signed Order appointing Attorney Michael Verrilli.
Defendant without counsel.  Court determines that defendant is eligible for counsel to be appointed at COUNTY expense.  Defendant to re-pay is HELD OPEN at this time.  The court will appoint ATTORNEY Michael Verrilli to represent the defendant.  Counsel accepts the appointment and is advised of the next court date.
Proposed Order appointing counsel received and filed.
Order to show cause hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

BRANCH 28 for BRANCH 15:

Court is advised that defendant is not in the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Dept.
Case could not proceed to hearing on today's date as defendant could not be made available via Zoom video.
Case is adjourned for order to show cause hearing in Branch 15.

Clerk:  jms
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

Defendant Francisco J Herrera not in court, defendant in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on standby. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests this matter be set in the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Rebecca H.; Richard A.L.; Carlos N.-M.; Hector M.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Francisco J Herrera in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Francisco J Herrera in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Francisco J Herrera appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
